title: How to create and delete users or contacts
content:
This topic describes how to create a user or contact, and how to delete a contact.

How to create a user or contact

You can either manually create a user/contact or automatically create a user by using the corresponding business rule.

Manually create a user or contact

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > People.
  2. Click New.

  3. Enter the following information:

    • New person information

      Field Description
      First name

      The first name of the person.
      Last name

      The last name of the person.
      Name The Name field is populated by the values entered in the First name and Last name fields. It can also be edited manually.
      Create user Specify whether you want to create a user record in Suite Administration.

      Note The field is visible only when the suite admin has enabled the "Manage users in tenant" feature in Suite Administration.
      Authentication type If you selected Create user, specify the authentication type for the user: DB or LDAP/SAML/OAUTH.
      Email

      The person's email address.
      User principal name

      The person's primary identifier in Service Management. This field is only editable during the creation of a new person. You can enter up to 64 characters. Spaces, tabs, semicolon (;), equal (=), ampersand (&), angle brackets (<>), octothorpe (#), curly brackets ({}), pipe (|), back quote (`), caret (^), tilde (~), percent (%), question mark (?), quotation mark ("), slash (/), square brackets ([]), or two consecutive underscores (_) can't be used in this field.

      If Create user is selected, the person's UPN is saved to Suite Administration as the login name.
      Employee Id The person's employee Id.
      Office phone number

      The person's office phone number.
      Mobile phone number The person's mobile phone number.
      Location

      Where the person is located. Select a value from the drop-down list.

      Examples:

      • France/Paris
      • EMEA/Spain/Madrid/M1

      To manage locations, see Locations.

    • Organizational information

      Field Description
      Employment type

      The person's employee type. Select a value from the drop-down list.

      The available options are:

      • Full-time
      • Part-time
      • Contractor
      • Internal
      • External
      Title

      The person's title. The title can be job- or organization-related.

      Examples: Process Owner, Manager, Agent
      Manager The person's manager. Select a value from the drop-down list.
      Company

      The person's company. Select a value from the drop-down list.
    • Availability
      Field Description
      Work schedule Select a work schedule for the person
      Time zone Select a time zone for the person

      The work schedule and time zone may be used in SLT calculation for the person if configured as such. For more information, see SLT settings.

  4. Click Save, or click Save & add another to add another user or contact.

Note You can also sync contacts from an LDAP server using the LDAP integration. For more information, see How to set up synchronization with LDAP.

Create a user using the business rule

You can automatically create a user by using the Create user business rule template. It's available for the Request, Person, Task, Change, Offering, Incident, and Project record types under the After applying changes event in Studio. You can also use this rule template on the Task plan tab of an applicable record.

This example uses the Task plan of a service offering to describe how to create a user by using the rule template.

  1. From the main menu, choose Plan > Service Category > Offerings.
  2. Click New and specify the required parameters to create an offering.
  3. Click the offering ID and go to the Task plan tab. In the Task plan section, click the Fulfill tab.
  4. Hover over Start, click the pencil icon that appears, and then click Automated task.
  5. In the New automatic task dialog box that appears, enter the fields as needed, for example, specify the task name as Create a user. In the Business rule section, click Set rule, select Create user, and then click OK.
  6. Specify the parameters as needed and click OK. For example:
    • UPN: ${entity.UserOptions.Upn_c}
    • First name: ${entity.UserOptions.FirstName_c}
    • Last name: ${entity.UserOptions.LastName_c}
    • Email: ${entity.UserOptions.Email_c}
    • Authentication type: ${entity.UserOptions.AuthType_c}
  7. Go to the User options tab and add the corresponding fields for them to appear in the service request.
  8. Click Save.
  9. Go to Service Portal, search for the Create a user offering created earlier, and then click Request.
  10. Enter the fields as required and click Submit.
  11. From the main menu, choose Run > Service Request.
  12. Click the ID of the service request submitted earlier.
  13. In the Assignment section, specify the required parameters to assign the request for approval and click Save.
  14. Go to the Task plan tab and check the task status. When it enters the Completed state, go to Administration > Master Data > People and verify that the desired user is created automatically. 

How to delete a contact record

Note You can delete only contacts, not users.
  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > People.

  2. Select the contact you want to delete.

    To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button. For more information, see Filters.

  3. Click Delete on the toolbar.

  4. Click OK.

Tip Click Find to search for the required contact using the Find people dialog.
